Richard I "The Lion-Hearted" of England (1157-1199) was a leader of the Third Crusade, beginning in 1191. He agreed to a 3-year truce with Saladin. He also suggested that his sister, Johanna, marry Saladin’s brother, Malek el Adel, and that the two rule Jerusalem together, but the Church vetoed the idea. On his way home, Richard was captured by Leopold of Austria and held for two years until a ransom was paid.
